Content.Name: ASN Courses
Content.Title: ASN Courses
Content.BodyCopy:
NURS 100 Introductory Nursing (ASN) (6 Credits)

Total Course Fees: $230.00
Prerequisites: BIO 264, CHEM 101, BIO 265
This course provides the learner experience in utilizing the nursing process to provide
fundamental care for patients in long-term and acute-care settings.
(Fall, Winter, Spring)

NURS 110 The Art of Nursing (ASN) (1 Credit)

Total Course Fees: $10.00
Prerequisites: NURS 100
Introduction of concepts related to nursing professionalism including: values, leadership,
economics, ethics, teaching/learning, legal implications, cultural, and spiritual aspects.
Communication and interpersonal skills will be emphasized.
(Spring Fall)

NURS 122 Medical Surgical Nursing 1 (5 Credits)

Total Course Fees: $120.00
This course builds on the learner's knowledge of health concerns involving musculoskeletal,
endocrine, integumentary, gastrointestinal, and urinary systems incorporating the
Nursing Process through the Conceptual Model in caring for individuals throughout the
wellness continuum.
(Fall, Winter, Spring)

NURS 123 Psychiatric / Mental Health Nursing (2 Credits)

Total Course Fees: $60.00
Formerly Nurs 103
This course applies the Nursing Process and BYU-Idaho Conceptual Model in exploring
psychiatric issues, and mental-health concerns of individuals, families, and communities.
(Fall, Winter, Spring)

NURS 230 Medical Surgical Nursing 2 (6 Credits)

Total Course Fees: $120.00
This course provides the learner knowledge and experience using the nursing process with
the conceptual model as a guide, in caring for complex individuals and their families in
preventative, acute-care and rehabilitative care situations.
(Fall, Winter, Spring)
(This course will not be taught before Fall, 2012)

NURS 236 Ethical / Legal Issues (1 Credit)

Total Course Fees: $55.00
Formerly NURS 206
This course utilizes the Nursing Process and the BYU-Idaho Conceptual Model to explore
ethical and legal issues in nursing. Accountability as the main focus on nursing will be
explored.
(Winter Fall)

NURS 222 Maternal-Child Nursing (6 Credits)

Total Course Fees: $120.00
This semester course is based in family theory and applies the nursing process and
BYU-Idaho Conceptual Model in exploring variations in the functional health patterns in
women and children across the life-span from normal to high-risk patients.
(Fall, Winter, Spring)

NURS 225 Career Planning and the Professional Nurse (1 Credit)

Formerly NURS 205
This semester course utilizes the conceptual model to help the student focus on entry into
professional nursing practice, i.e., employment opportunities, health care trends, etc.
(Fall, Winter, Spring)
